laboratory_examinations.findings: Low levels of haemoglobin (9.7 g/dL). No coagulation abnormalities were detected.
Enlargement of the right atrium and ventricle with moderate tricuspid regurgitation and mild mitral regurgitation. Left ventricular ejection fraction was 57% and had decreased.

60-mm infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, 55-mm right common iliac artery aneurysm, 42-mm right external iliac artery aneurysm. Noted prominent tortuosity below the abdominal aorta. An arteriovenous fistula developed between the aneurysm and peripheral artery, dilating towards the popliteal artery. Distal popliteal artery occluded.
